Comment: >The Trump administration is once again putting [LGBTQ](http://advocate.com/lgbt)\+ lives at risk — this time by proposing to gut federal support for the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline’s [LGBTQ](https://www.pride.com/lgbtq/?utm_campaign=SmartLinks)\+ Youth Specialized Services.  >“For countless LGBTQ+ individuals, the crisis line isn’t just a service — it’s a lifeline,” [Karine Jean-Pierre](https://www.advocate.com/politics/karine-jean-pierre-exit-interview), former White House press secretary and longtime champion of LGBTQ+ rights, told *The Advocate*. “It’s what stands between despair and survival, isolation and hope.”     And that's what Republicans want. Comment: So this isn't  deliberately inflicting on a group conditions of life calculated to to bring about its physical destruction through whole or in part?   Like say demonizing parts of the lgbtq community as rapists, murderers and deviants who want to harm you. Then taking away their human rights and legalizing the discrimination against them to create harsh mental torment. Then to take away life saving resources meant to prevent physical harm from coming to vulnerable groups?  Go back and read what genocide is. Actually go read it. It is alot more than just sending us to camps to be gased and cremated. We were some of the first targets in the holocaust, we were some of the last to be freed from the prisons decades after the war. Do not tell me what is or isn't genocide. People like me have suffered countless genocides that other people try to undercut and say is bad but not genocide.
Author: TheJadeGoddess

Comment: No, you are entirely wrong, hyperbolic and dramatic. Cancelling a suicide hotline is a bad policy and decision for the health of the LGBTQ people, based on prejudice, but it's not a genocide, by any means. It's not a systematic threat, either, as most of them aren't actively suicidal.  The systematic deportation of 2 million Armenians to the Syrian desert, where there were left to die, is a genocide. The systematic killing of nearly a million Tutsis by Hutus in Rwanda is a genocide. The rounding of Jews and their extermination in gas chambers by Nazis is a genocide. Cancelling a suicide hotline isn't, even remotely.
Author: Same_Performance_595

Comment: Cool, its not just canceling a phone line. Taking away health care, hot lines and basic civil rights from a group is genocide. There is more than just this and you know it. Stop down playing the genocide against the lgbtq community. It doesnt have to get to gas chambers to be a problem, or a genocide.
